formalpara.title: Software
formalpara.para:
The main software components you need for a working &lj; installation are as follows (the recommended version is noted):
Perl Version 5.8.x
&mysql; Version 5.0.x
&apache; Version 1.3.34
&modperl; Version 1.29
Subversion Any version. You need this to get the &lj; software, and updates

warning.title: &apache; 2 & &modperl; 2
warning.simpara: At this time, &lj; has not been ported to & will not work with &apache; 2 & &modperl; 2.

formalpara.title: Versions
formalpara.para: These are the recommended versions. The versions available in &debian; Stable plus any security updates are commonly used for &lj; installations. It does not matter if you have a different, perhaps more recent, minor/incremental software version (e.g. 1.3.35). An exception to this point is &modperl;: version 1.99 is part of the &modperl; 2 series, which will not work with &lj;.

formalpara.title: Hardware
formalpara.para: There are no specific hardware requirements for a &lj; installation, but &apache;/&modperl; and &mysql; can utilize a lot of memory very quickly. Determining the right amount of processor speed, storage space, and RAM depends on how busy your &lj; installation will be. A simple rule of thumb to remember is that posts and comments drive site traffic, not necessarily the presence of more users.
